intro: Costus septimus, commonly known as the red ginger or false arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features tall, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical characteristics of Costus septimus make it both ornamental and economically valuable in horticulture and herbal practices.
